name: 阮祥微
objective:
To compete in today's business environment, it is vital that all employees are working to their potential. However, motivating employees is a complex process. It requires an understanding of the needs, wants and expectations of that employee.
This course provides a foundation in leadership approaches, theories and concepts of motivation. Selected topics include: trait and behavioral theories of leadership, charismatic, transformational, and servant leadership, emotions and justice perceptions in motivation, individual and team motivation. This course provides students with both theoretical and practical knowledge and prepares them for future career as motivation and leadership are fundamentals issues directly relate to organizational performance.
